result.execSummary:
The defendant William Brian Fogarty was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: count two.  Credit for 22 days.
Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan signed and filed.
Court allows transfer of defendant's probation and jail time to Waukesha County if accepted.

miscConds.notes:
AS TO THIS CASE: Provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge if not previously done.
Fine of $1,200.00, all remaing costs, fees and surcharges.  To be paid over duration of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  Bail to apply.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Not to drive any motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
Comply with the standard rules of probation.
Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment.  Follow any recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

timeConds.notes:
The first six months to be served straight time.
Balance of six months, Court allows release privileges for employment and treatment purposes only..................................***DECISION AND ORDER; August 5, 2014/Judge Donald/Court amends JOC to allow good time credit while serving conditional jail term in this case.***

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: count one.   Credit for zero days.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William Brian Fogarty

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Granting Request for Good Time, signed and filed.

Defendant William Brian Fogarty in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Catelin A Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court heard sentencing recommendations.
Additional statements made by defendant's neighbor, Jesse G., and the defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:   The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 60 MONTHS, concurrent to Count 2, with credit for 22 days time served.
INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 30 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 30  MONTHS. 

Court finds the defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds the defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

The Court STAYED this sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 3 YEARS under the supervision of the Department of Corrections.  


AS TO COUNT 2:  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 42 MONTHS, concurrent to Count 1, with credit for ZERO days time served. 
INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 MONTHS.

Court finds the defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds the defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

The Court STAYED this sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 3 YEARS under the supervision of the Department of Corrections.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2 :
* Comply with the standard rules of probation.
* SERVE one (1) year "condition time" at the House of Correction.  First 6 months are to be served STRAIGHT TIME.  As to the remaining 6 months, Court allows release priviledges for employment and treatment purposes only.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* PAY fine in the amount of $1,200.00 - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge (if not previously done) - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Cash bail on deposit to apply.
* PAY the balance of remaining court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  Cash bail on deposit to apply.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Court ordered defendant's  driver operating priveleges REVOKED for 24 months from today's date.  Reinstatement fee to apply.
* Any vehicle titled in the defendant's name or driven by the defendant is to have an ignition interlock device installed for 18 months.
* Defendant is NOT to drive any motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
**Court ALLOWS transfer of defendant's probation and jail time to Waukesha County if accepted.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 

Appeal rights given.
(DEFENDANT REMANDED INTO CUSTODY WITH THE SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT IN COURT)

Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
State Crime Lab's Blood Toxicology Report as to the defendant.
Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan.

Defendant William Brian Fogarty in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Catelin A Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form tendered to the Court.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.
(2) Character Witness Letters as to the defendant; filed.

Defendant William Brian Fogarty in court.  Catelin A Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court adjourns this matter to give Atty. Devitt an opportunity to appear.

1/28/14 vf
from family member of defendant, filed; copies distributed.

Defendant William Brian Fogarty in court with Imran Kurter, student intern under the supervision of with attorney Francisco Araiza for Anne A Devitt.  Defendant William Brian Fogarty in custody.  Catelin A. Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Greg Blunt-West Allis Police Department Officer.  Stipulation to the defendant having four previous OWI convictions is agreed upon by the parties and approved by the court.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by  drug tests and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant William Brian Fogarty in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Defendant William Brian Fogarty in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.   Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
